page.title: 18Nature trail,N.Wingfield
page.content: The{FIVE PITS TRAIL}has been opened recently in the area.It runs along the disused track of the{Great Central {Railway}.It is designed to be used by walkers ,cylists and horseriders. Eventually it will be part of a large network of trails, linking most of { {North East Derbyshire}.The trail links the sites of 5 historic collieries-{ {Tibshelf, Pilsley, Holmewood, {Williamthorpe and Grassmoor}.Along the 3.5 mile trail, the sites have been carefully returned to forestry and agriculture,providing a rural setting.The gentle hills of the trail ensure pleasant views all around. The countryside around supports abundant wildlife, including,{kestrel, lapwing {& heron}.The section of the trail in this area is also suitable, in parts, for wheelchair users. * Further information-Clay Cross Ranger *
